conclusion: Determine the pressure of the gas when the temperature is 600 K using the p-T graph.
The p-T graph shows a linear relationship between pressure (p) and temperature (T) with points (200 K, 0.5 x 10^5 Pa) and (400 K, 1.0 x 10^5 Pa).
Calculate the slope of the line as 2.5 x 10^2 Pa/K.
Find the equation of the line using point-slope form, resulting in p = 2.5 x 10^2 x T.
Calculate the pressure at 600 K as 1.5 x 10^5 Pa.
The pressure of the gas when the temperature is 600 K is 1.5 x 10^5 Pa.
